name: clustering
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
cluster
(of a group of similar things or people) to form a group, sometimes by surrounding something, or to make something do this: People clustered around the noticeboard to read the exam results. The hens cluster together at the sight of strangers, going quiet.
More examplesFewer examplesThey clustered together in the corner watching the noisy prisoners and their visitors.The residents clustered in awkward groups, checking their watches. Everyone clustered round them, calling greetings.
